clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of COPD by Autologous Transplantation of Bronchial Basal Cells
clinical_study.official_title: Primary Research on Treatment of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) by Transplantation of Autologous Bronchial Basal Cells

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Shantou University Medical College

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Shantou University Medical College

brief_summary.textblock: Bronchial basal cells are proved to be able to regenerate lung structures to repair the injured lung. In COPD patients, bronchus structures are injured and cannot be repaired, which may result in the failure of pulmonary function rescue clinically.In our research, autologous bronchial basal cells will be transplanted into lung of patients suffered with COPD to treat the disease. Specifically, autologous bronchial basal cells will be dissected from brushed-off samples by bronchofiberscope. Then, they will be expanded in vitro and transplanted into lung to regenerate new alveoli and bronchus structures and re-establish pulmonary system.

primary_outcome.measure: Forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1)
primary_outcome.description: An indicator for pulmonary function test to assess airway obstruction
An indicator for pulmonary function test to indicate the maximum amount of air a person can expel from the lungs after a maximum inhalation

secondary_outcome.description: An indicator for pulmonary function test to show the extent to which oxygen passes from the air sacs of the lungs into the blood

secondary_outcome.measure: The ratio of forced expiratory volume in the first one second to the forced vital capacity (FEV1/FVC)
secondary_outcome.description: An indicator in pulmonary function test to represent the proportion of a person's vital capacity that they are able to expire in the first second of forced expiration to the full vital capacity
An indicator in pulmonary function test to stand for maximal (mid-)expiratory flow and is the peak of expiratory flow as taken from the flow-volume curve and measured in liters per second
An indicator in pulmonary function test to measure the maximum amount of air that can be inhaled and exhaled within one minute
An indicator to evaluate the exercise function of patients with moderate or severe pulmonary heart diseases

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified medical research council (MMRC) chronic dyspnea scale
secondary_outcome.description: An indicator to evaluate the level of dyspnea
A questionnaire to assess life quality affected by the respiratory problems

arm_group.description: Patients will receive of clinical grade bronchial basal cells (BBCs) with a dosage of 10^6 (1 million) cells/Kg/person via fiberoptic bronchoscopy after fully lavage of the localized lesions.
